title: Bug 6125 - JAR packager reports open files very late
description: When pressing finish, the JAR creation fails and displays the error message 'JAR creation failed: Unsaved Editors'5.
OB: Attempting to create a JAR file with unsaved editors causes the JAR packager to fail and display an error message.
EB: I should be able to create a JAR file even with unsaved editors. If there are unsaved editors, a dialog should be displayed to allow for saving before proceeding with JAR creation.
SR:
1. Open the JAR packager tool.
2. Add some files to be included in the JAR.
3. Do not save any of the opened files.
4. Click on the 'Finish' button to create the JAR.
5. Verify that the JAR creation fails and an error message is displayed.
6. Observe that there is no option to save the unsaved editors.
7. Close the JAR packager.
8. Save the unsaved editors.
9. Open the JAR packager tool again.
10. Verify that the previously added files are still included in the JAR.
11. Attempt to create the JAR again with the saved editors.
12. Verify that the JAR creation is successful.
